intro: Malvastrum catalinense, commonly known as Catalina mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
